topic.title: Installing as non-root, non-sudo
topic.shortdesc: Installing on Ubuntu as non-root, non-sudo is for development purposes only.

body.p: There may be cases when you want to install the server as a non-root, non-sudo user. If you perform a non-sudo, non-root installation you will be still be able to run Couchbase Server and all Couchbase command-line tools. To do so on Ubuntu:

ol.li:
After downloading the Couchbase DEB package, go to the directory where it is located and extract it:
> dpkg-deb -x couchbase-server-community_x86_64_2.0.0-1767-rel.deb $HOME
In the directory where you extracted the files, you will see opt and etc subdirectories.

After you extract the Couchbase Server install files, go to the subdirectory:
cd opt/couchbase

Run this password-related script:
./bin/install/reloc.sh `pwd`
This enables you to continue the install as a non-root, non-sudo user.
